armyRules.name: For the Greater Good
armyRules.description:
If your Army Faction is T’AU EMPIRE, at the start of your Shooting phase you can select units from your army with this ability to become Observer units.
During your Shooting phase, for each Observer unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase and is eligible to shoot (excluding FORTIFICATION and Battle-shocked units) select one enemy unit that is visible to be marked as their Spotted unit until the end of the phase. Each enemy unit can only be marked as a Spotted unit once per phase.
Units from your army with the For the Greater Good ability (excluding Observer units) are Guided units while targeting one or more Spotted units.
Until the end of the phase, each time a model from your army in a Guided unit makes an attack that targets a Spotted unit, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of that attack by 1 and, if the Spotted unit was marked by an Observer unit that has the MARKERLIGHT keyword, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.
armyRules.flavorText: The Hunter Cadres battle for the betterment of the T’au Empire, not for personal gain or egotistic accomplishments. This burning commitment allows for prodigiously effective covering fire. Enemies are pinned in place by deadly bursts of pulse blasts, or the infamous T’au markerlight is used to expose even well-fortified enemy positions, allowing other T’au warriors to fall on the vulnerable enemies with murderous force.

detachments.name: Kauyon
detachments.abilityDescription: During the third, fourth and fifth battle rounds, ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. During the third, fourth and fifth battle rounds, while a unit is a Guided unit (see For the Greater Good), each time a ranged attack is made by a model in that unit that targets a Spotted unit, you can ignore any or all modifiers to that attack’s Ballistic skill characteristics and/or all modifiers to the Hit roll.
detachments.abilityFlavorText: The tactical philosophy known as the Kauyon allows for T’au commanders to draw the enemy into a deadly trap, springing it at the perfect moment to deliver a storm of fatal strikes against which none can escape.

stratagems.name: A TEMPTING TRAP
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase. The first time you use this Stratagem, you must also select one objective marker that is not in your opponent’s deployment zone; until the end of the battle, this becomes your Trap objective marker.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within range of your Trap objective marker, add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

stratagems.name: POINT-BLANK AMBUSH
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a ranged attack that targets an enemy unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot use this Stratagem during the first or second battle rounds.

stratagems.name: COORDINATE TO ENGAGE
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has just been selected as an Observer unit (see For the Greater Good).
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets their Spotted unit, improve the Ballistic Skill characteristic of that attack by 1 and, if your unit has the MARKERLIGHT keyword, that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

stratagems.name: COMBAT EMBARKATION
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge, and one friendly TRANSPORT.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can embark within that TRANSPORT. If it does, your opponent can select new targets for that charge.
stratagems.restrictions: Every model in your T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit must be within 3" of that TRANSPORT and there must be sufficient transport capacity to embark the entire unit.

stratagems.name: PHOTON GRENADES
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE GRENADES unit from your army that was selected as one of the targets of that charge.
stratagems.effect: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test, and until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.

stratagems.name: WALL OF MIRRORS
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One STEALTH, GHOSTKEEL or COMMANDER SHADOWSUN unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot target a unit that is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.

enhancements.name: Exemplar of the Kauyon
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, the Patient Hunter Detachment rule applies to that unit from the second battle round onwards instead of from the third.
enhancements.flavorText: Long meditation upon the tenets of the Patient Hunter has seen this warrior master the application of this cunning ambush strategy. When they take to the battlefield, they embody the teachings of the Kauyon, much to the dismay of their luckless prey.

enhancements.name: Precision of the Patient Hunter
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Each time the bearer makes a ranged attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. From the third battle round onwards, add 1 to the Wound roll as well.
enhancements.flavorText: This warrior prowls the battlefield like a high-tech predator, stalking and assessing their quarry before they strike. When they do launch their assault, their every shot and blow is informed by careful observations, perfectly aimed where they will do the greatest harm.

enhancements.name: Solid-image Projection Unit
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to three T’AU EMPIRE units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.
enhancements.flavorText: This holowave-emitter drone projects beams of so-called heavy light, forming convincing illusory images while simultaneously masking the true locations of its allies with advanced refraction fields.

enhancements.name: Through Unity, Devastation
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, each time that unit is an Observer unit, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in a Guided unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability while targeting their Spotted unit.
enhancements.flavorText: Under their calm tutelage of this leader, warriors of the Fire caste maximise every shot they fire, creating a blizzard of deadly energy.

detachments.name: Mont’ka
detachments.abilityDescription: During the first, second and third battle rounds, ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army have the [ASSAULT] ability. During the first, second and third battle rounds, while a unit is a Guided unit, its ranged weapons have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
detachments.abilityFlavorText: Mont’ka is the most aggressive style of T’au warfare. Its singular focus is the art of identifying a target of opportunity and attacking it swiftly with an overwhelming application of force.

stratagems.name: PINPOINT COUNTER-OFFENSIVE
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the battle, each time a T’AU EMPIRE unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army makes an attack that targets the enemy unit that just destroyed your unit, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

stratagems.name: AGGRESSIVE MOBILITY
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, if your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

stratagems.name: FOCUSED FIRE
stratagems.target: Two T’AU EMPIRE units from your army that have not been selected to shoot this phase, and one enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target for that attack), and when resolving that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic by 1.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot use this Stratagem during the fourth or fifth battle rounds.

stratagems.name: COMBAT DEBARKATION
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit from your army that disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets the closest enemy unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: PULSE ONSLAUGHT
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE INFANTRY unit (excluding KROOT units) from your army that has just shot, and one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of your opponent’s next turn, that enemy unit is shaken. While a unit is shaken, subtract 2 from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for it.

stratagems.name: COUNTERFIRE DEFENCE SYSTEMS
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: s.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

enhancements.name: Coordinated Exploitation
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, each time that unit is an Observer unit, until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in a Guided unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability while targeting their Spotted unit.
enhancements.flavorText: This leader eschews their own martial glory in favour of seeking out an advanced vantage point then exploiting it to guide in the firepower of their fellows.

enhancements.name: Exemplar of the Mont’ka
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only (excluding KROOT SHAPER models). While the bearer is leading a unit, the Killing Blow Detachment rule applies to that unit during the fourth battle round as well.
enhancements.flavorText: This warrior has perfected the art of the Killing Blow, formulating swift and decisive battle plans and leading their cadres from the front in aggressive strikes.

enhancements.name: Strategic Conqueror
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. At the start of the first battle round, before the first turn begins, select one objective marker on the battlefield. While a friendly T’AU EMPIRE model is within range of that objective marker and the bearer is on the battlefield, add 1 to that friendly model’s Objective Control characteristic.
enhancements.flavorText: A wise commander appreciates the strategic value of seizing a vital battlefield asset swiftly to establish a foothold, employing it as a jumping off point for further assaults or a rallying post for a swift retreat.

enhancements.name: Strike Swiftly
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. At the start of the battle, before any moves are made using the Scouts ability, you can select up to two friendly T’AU EMPIRE units within 6" of the bearer that do not have the Scouts ability. Until the end of the battle, all models in the selected units have the Scouts 6" ability.
enhancements.flavorText: This commander knows victory is best assured by taking the fight to the enemy as soon as battle is joined.

detachments.name: Retaliation Cadre
detachments.abilityDescription: Each time a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army makes a ranged attack that targets a unit within 12", improve the Strength characteristic of that attack by 1. If that attack targets a unit within 9", improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1 as well.
detachments.abilityFlavorText: Cadres of T’au Battlesuit pilots fight in a manner inspired by the dynamism and determination of famous and beloved war leaders. Indeed, some of the specialist piloting manoeuvres they employ are named after such icons, in a few rare - and sometimes unofficial - cases even after those who have since fallen far from favour with the Ethereal Council. Either way, these bonded veterans are experts in the deadly art of engaging the enemy in close confines. They plunge into the heart of the enemy army where the fighting is fiercest, and prevail in the name of the Greater Good.

stratagems.name: FAIL-SAFE DETONATOR
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after a T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model from your army is destroyed.
stratagems.target: That destroyed model’s unit. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even if that unit was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Before removing your model from play, if it has the Deadly Demise ability, do not roll for that ability; instead, you can choose whether the result of that roll is a 1 or a 6. If your model does not have the Deadly Demise ability, roll one D6 for each unit within 6" of it: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

stratagems.name: STIMM INJECTORS
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: s.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

stratagems.name: THE SHORTENED BLADE
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 6" horizontally away from all enemy models.
stratagems.restrictions: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

stratagems.name: THE ARRO’KON PROTOCOL
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that contains 6 or more models, that attack has the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. If that attack targets an enemy unit that contains 11 or more models, it has the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.

stratagems.name: THE TORCHSTAR GAMBIT
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that can FLY whose attacks have been resolved this phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move. If it does, your unit cannot declare a charge this turn

stratagems.name: GRAV-INHIBITOR FIELD
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge.
stratagems.effect: That enemy unit must immediately take a Battle-shock test and you must roll one D6 for each model in that enemy unit: for each 6, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.

enhancements.name: Internal Grenade Racks
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. The bearer has the Grenades keyword, and each time the bearer ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit that it moved over during that move. If you do, roll six D6: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
enhancements.flavorText: These thigh plates house deployment rails of high-explosive bomblets. As the pilot jets over the foe, the racks can be triggered to dispense a rain of death.

enhancements.name: Prototype Weapon System
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. Each time the bearer is selected to shoot, select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. Until those attacks are resolved, ranged weapons equipped by the bearer have the selected ability.
enhancements.flavorText: Famed battlesuit pilots are often more than willing to assist Earth caste scientists infield-testing the latest in experimental weapons technology.

enhancements.name: Puretide Engram Neurochip
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. Each time you target the bearer’s unit with a Stratagem, roll one D6: on a 4+, you gain 1CP.
enhancements.flavorText: Commander Puretide was the most gifted T’au war leader of all time. Upon his death, his memories were stored in a neurochip. When implanted into the brain, the bearer can access much of this wisdom.

enhancements.name: Starflare Ignition System
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT model only. At the end of your opponent’s turn, if the bearer’s unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove that unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
enhancements.flavorText: The ignition thrusters on selected battlesuits are augmented with optional feed-selectors, allowing the pilot to release a jet of enriched accelerant upon take-off and sending the pilots streaking skywards.

detachments.name: Kroot Hunting Pack
detachments.abilityDescription: Each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll if the target of that attack is below its Starting Strength, and add 1 to the Wound roll as well if the target of that attack is Below Half-strength.
detachments.abilityFlavorText: The Kroot naturally predate upon weakened foes, drawn by the scent of spilled blood and viscera.

stratagems.name: JOIN THE HUNT
stratagems.target: One KROOT INFANTRY or KROOT HOUNDS unit from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that unit even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.effect: Add a new unit to your army identical to your destroyed unit, in Strategic Reserves, at its Starting Strength.
stratagems.restrictions: This Stratagem cannot be used to return destroyed CHARACTER units to Attached units. You can only use this Stratagem once per battle.

stratagems.name: A TRAP WELL LAID
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: After your unit has resolved its attacks this phase, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a KROOT model from your army makes an attack that targets that enemy unit, unless the attacking unit is Battle-shocked, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

stratagems.name: EMP GRENADES
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy VEHICLE unit is selected to shoot or fight.
stratagems.target: One KROOT GRENADES unit from your army within 8" of that enemy VEHICLE unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, worsen the Weapon Skill and Ballistic Skill characteristics of that enemy VEHICLE unit’s weapons by 1.

stratagems.name: THE GRISLY FEAST
stratagems.target: One KROOT unit from your army that destroyed one or more enemy units this phase.
stratagems.effect: In your opponent’s next Command phase, each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle-shock test. If the unit taking that test is Below Half-strength, subtract 1 from that test. Enemy units affected by this Stratagem do not need to take any other Battle-shock tests in the same phase.

stratagems.name: GUERRILLA WARRIORS
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a KROOT unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.target: That KROOT unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge.

stratagems.name: HIDDEN HUNTERS
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: s.TARGET: One KROOT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

enhancements.name: Borthrod Gland
enhancements.description: Kroot Flesh Shaper only. While the bearer is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
enhancements.flavorText: The Kroot found the flesh of the Borthrod so irresistible they hunted them to extinction. This preserved gland still exudes pheromones that drive nearby Kroot into a ravenous frenzy.

enhancements.name: Kroothawk Flock
enhancements.description: KROOT model only. Ranged weapons equipped by models in the bearer’s unit have the [IGNORES COVER] ability, and enemy units that are set up on the battlefield as Reinforcements cannot be set up within 12" horizontally of the bearer.
enhancements.flavorText: This leader has painstakingly established a deep-seated bond with a small flock of Kroothawks. The avian creatures circle on high, spying out and revealing the hiding places of the prey or warning of ambushing enemies with wing-dips, diving stoops and harsh shrieks.

enhancements.name: Nomadic Hunter
enhancements.description: KROOT TRAIL SHAPER model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, add 3" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit and ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [ASSAULT] ability.
enhancements.flavorText: This Shaper’s followers have become adept at the loping pursuit, snapping off harassing fire as they tirelessly and mercilessly run their victims to ground.

enhancements.name: Root-carved Weapons
enhancements.description: Kroot War Shaper model only. All weapons equipped by the bearer have the [PRECISION] and [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] abilities.
enhancements.flavorText: Just as the Kroot venerate the so-called Roots from which their culture derives, so they prize the traditional forms of Root-carved weapons and must perform exceptional deeds to be permitted to wield them in war.

detachments.name: Auxiliary Cadre
detachments.abilityDescription:
KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units from your army have the following ability:
Targeting Triangulation (Aura): While an enemy unit is within 9" of and visible to this unit, each time a ranged attack made by a friendly T’AU EMPIRE model (excluding KROOT, VESPID STINGWINGS and TITANIC models) targets that enemy unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
T’AU EMPIRE units (excluding KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units) from your army have the following ability:
Localised Stealth Projectors (Aura): While a friendly KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit is wholly within 6" of and visible to this unit, that KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".
detachments.abilityFlavorText: T’au officers given charge of auxiliary cadres receive additional training in optimised doctrinal and strategic alien amalgamation; this - coupled with specialised translation drones and endless integrated combat drills - allows them to get the best out of their alien subordinates.

stratagems.name: EXPERIMENTAL MODIFICATIONS
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

stratagems.name: MULTISENSORY SCANNING
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If it is a KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.

stratagems.name: INTERLOCKING MANOUEVRES
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that was eligible to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: If your unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". Otherwise, your unit can make a Fall Back move. It cannot embark within a TRANSPORT at the end of this move if it disembarked from a TRANSPORT this turn.

stratagems.name: PHEROMONE WAYPOINTS
stratagems.target: One KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time your unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in your unit.

stratagems.name: ALIEN EXPERTISE
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot in a turn in which it Advanced. If it is a KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit, until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced as well.

stratagems.name: GUIDED FIRE
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army (excluding KROOT and VESPID STINGWINGS units) that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit. If your unit is wholly within 9" of one or more KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS units from your army, add 2 to the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit instead.

enhancements.name: Student of Kauyon
enhancements.description: KROOT SHAPER model only. In the Declare Battle Formations step, you can select up to three KROOT CARNIVORES or KROOT FARSTALKERS units from your army. Models in those units have the Deep Strike ability.
enhancements.flavorText: This Shaper has not only studied the Code of Fire but has also adapted it to best suit their people’s skills.

enhancements.name: Admired Leader
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model (excluding KROOT models) only. In your Command phase, you can select one KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS unit within 12" of the bearer. If you do, until the start of your next Command phase, improve the Leadership characteristic of models in that unit by 1, and while such a unit is not Battle-shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.
enhancements.flavorText: Having proven themselves to their alien charges, this T’au has won their fierce loyalty and become an iconic folk hero to them.

enhancements.name: Fanatical Convert
enhancements.description: KROOT model only. The bearer’s unit has the For the Greater Good ability.
enhancements.flavorText: This true believer strives to embody the T’au’va even more entirely than the T’au themselves.

enhancements.name: Transponder Lock Module
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE WALKER model with the Deep Strike ability only. The bearer’s unit can be set up using the Deep Strike ability in the Reinforcements step of your first, second or third Movement phase, regardless of any mission rules. During your first Movement phase, when you set up the bearer’s unit, it must be set up within 12" of one or more friendly KROOT or VESPID STINGWINGS units and not within 9" horizontally of one or more enemy units.
enhancements.flavorText: This system detects transponders borne deep into the field by alien auxiliaries and guides its user unerringly in on their positions.

detachments.name: Experimental Prototype Cadre
detachments.abilityDescription: Add 6" to the Range characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by T’AU EMPIRE models from your army
detachments.abilityFlavorText: The applied science divisions of the Earth caste labour endlessly to provide front-line units with expertly crafted instruments of destruction.

stratagems.name: AUTOMATED REPAIR DRONES
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Select one BATTLESUIT model in your unit: that model regains up to D3+1 lost wounds.

stratagems.name: REACTIVE IMPACT DAMPENERS
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: s.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE BATTLESUIT unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of your unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: EXPERIMENTAL WEAPONRY
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time you roll one or more dice to determine the number of attacks made with a weapon equipped by a model in your unit, you can re-roll the result.

stratagems.name: EXPERIMENTAL AMMUNITION
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one of the following to apply to your unit until the end of the phase:Improve the Strength characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.Improve the Strength and Armour Penetration characteristics of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1, and those weapons have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot target the same unit with the Experimental Ammunition and Threat Assessment Analyser Stratagems in the same phase.

stratagems.name: THREAT ASSESSMENT ANALYSER
stratagems.target: One T’AU EMPIRE unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Select the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] or [LETHAL HITS] ability. Until the end of the phase, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the selected ability. You can instead select the [SUSTAINED HITS 1], [LETHAL HITS] and [HAZARDOUS] abilities to apply to those weapons until the end of the phase.
stratagems.restrictions: You cannot target the same unit with the Experimental Ammunition and Threat Assessment Analyser Stratagems in the same phase.

stratagems.name: NEUROWEB SYSTEM JAMMER
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: s.TARGET: One T’AU EMPIRE CRISIS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 18".

enhancements.name: Supernova Launcher
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Select one airbursting fragmentation projector equipped by the bearer. Improve the Strength characteristic of that weapon by 3, and improve the Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics of that weapon by 1.
enhancements.flavorText: Adapted from standard-issue fragmentation projectors, this weapon enables the bearer to fire explosive plasma charges on parabolic trajectories. These projectiles drop amongst the enemy and explode in a coruscating fireball that evaporates metal and flesh alike.

enhancements.name: Thermoneutronic Projector
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Select one T’au flamer equipped by the bearer. Improve the Strength characteristic of that weapon by 2, and improve the Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics of that weapon by 1.
enhancements.flavorText: The thermoneutronic projector uses volatile gases siphoned from the coronae of neutron stars to expel a flame capable of searing through the armour plating of a battle tank.

enhancements.name: Plasma Accelerator Rifle
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Select one plasma rifle equipped by the bearer. Improve the Strength characteristic of that weapon by 2, and improve the Attacks, Armour Penetration and Damage characteristics of that weapon by 1.
enhancements.flavorText: The plasma accelerator rifle blends pulse-induction technology with a high-yield plasma generator, rendering it highly effective against both infantry and light vehicles.

enhancements.name: Fusion Blades
enhancements.description: T’AU EMPIRE model only. Select one fusion blaster equipped by the bearer. Improve the Attacks characteristic of that weapon by 1, improve the Strength characteristic of that weapon by 3, and that weapon has the [MELTA 4] ability.
enhancements.flavorText: Fusion blades resemble modified versions of the T’au fusion blaster. However, when fired, each weapon unleashes a continuous beam of volatile energy that extends from the muzzle of the weapon.
